      • drive

        public void drive(Vector2d leftPower,
                  Vector2d rightPower)
        Angles must be rotated in order to account for the way the projections work. If the joystick is pushed forward, then we want the robot to move forward and not rotate at all. This means that we want strict translation. This means we want a vector of (mag, 0) which corresponds to forward motion. Since the joystick is (0, mag), we want to rotate it by 90 degrees clockwise.

      • stopMotor

        public void stopMotor()

        public void disable()
